snippet: The suspects are accused of being members of a Congolese rebel group that planned to overthrow President Joseph Kabila of the Democratic Republic of Congo, a South African prosecutor said Thursday.
abstract: Nineteen people accused of being members of Congolese rebel group and planning to overthrow Pres Joseph Kabila of Democratic Republic of Congo are arrested in South Africa; group, which includes American citizen James Kazongo, offered mining rights in Congo to undercover officers in exchange for weapons and training.
lead_paragraph: The suspects are accused of being members of a Congolese rebel group that planned to overthrow President Joseph Kabila of the Democratic Republic of Congo, a South African prosecutor said Thursday.

headline.main: In South Africa, 19 Accused in Congo Plot
headline.print_headline: South Africa: 19 Accused in Congo Plot

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
